title: What Are The Steps Of Mediation?
summary: The parties can discuss the issues and concerns they have with each other, and the mediator can help guide the discussion and suggest ways the two sides might be able to settle on amicable terms that are mutually beneficial. Mediation sessions usually take place in a neutral location such as a mediation center. The mediator will then work with each party to structure the mediation session(s) in a way that helps both sides work together productively to reach an agreement. At the end of the session, the parties will usually agree on a written mediation agreement that will usually help the parties work together.
